Detailed Description

Header file that exposes the public interface of the BGPStream AS Path Store.

Author
Chiara Orsini, Alistair King

Definition in file bgpstream_utils_as_path_store.h.

Function Documentation

struct bgpstream_as_path_store_path_id __attribute__ ( (packed)  )

Represents a single path in the store.

A path ID should be treated as an opaque identifier.

Represents a single path in the store.

Simple ASN AS Path Segment.

The total number of paths in the store

The currently iterated pathset

The current path within the current pathset

int bgpstream_as_path_store_get_path_id ( bgpstream_as_path_store_t *  store,
bgpstream_as_path_t *  path,
uint32_t  peer_asn,
bgpstream_as_path_store_path_id_t *  id 
)

Get the ID of the given path from the store.

Parameters
storepointer to the store
pathpointer to the path to get the ID for
peer_asnASN of the peer that observed this path
[out]path_idpointer to a path ID structure to store the ID into
Returns
0 if the ID was populated correctly, -1 otherwise

If the path is not already in the store, it will be added

Definition at line 221 of file bgpstream_utils_as_path_store.c.

bgpstream_as_path_store_path_t* bgpstream_as_path_store_get_store_path ( bgpstream_as_path_store_t *  store,
bgpstream_as_path_store_path_id_t  id 
)

Get a (borrowed) pointer to the Store Path for the given Path ID.

Parameters
storepointer to the store
idID of the path to retrieve
Returns
borrowed pointer to the Store Path, NULL if no path exists

If a native BGPStream path is required, use the bgpstream_as_path_store_path_get_path function.

Definition at line 377 of file bgpstream_utils_as_path_store.c.

int bgpstream_as_path_store_insert_path ( bgpstream_as_path_store_t *  store,
uint8_t *  path_data,
uint16_t  path_len,
int  is_core,
bgpstream_as_path_store_path_id_t *  id 
)

Directly add the given path to the store and return the path ID.

Parameters
storepointer to the store
path_datapointer to the (core) path data byte array
path_lenthe number of bytes in the path_data array
is_coreindicates whether the path is a core path [out] path_id pointer to a path ID structure to store the ID into
Returns
0 if the ID was populated correctly, -1 otherwise
Note
this function is designed to be used when deserializing a path store. The bgpstream_as_path_store_get_path_id function should be preferred over this function wherever possible.
unlike the bgpstream_as_path_store_get_path_id function, the path passed to this function will not be altered in any when on insertion. That is, if the is_core flag is set, the path is assumed to already have had the peer segment removed.

Definition at line 302 of file bgpstream_utils_as_path_store.c.

Definition at line 331 of file bgpstream_utils_as_path_store.c.

uint32_t bgpstream_as_path_store_path_get_idx ( bgpstream_as_path_store_path_t *  store_path)

Get the internal index of the given store path.

Parameters
store_pathpointer to the store path to get the index of
Returns
index of the given path within the store

This function is designed to be used when serializing the entire store, and should be considered internal. The returned index is guaranteed to be in the range [0 -> bgpstream_as_path_store_get_size).

Definition at line 475 of file bgpstream_utils_as_path_store.c.

bgpstream_as_path_t* bgpstream_as_path_store_path_get_int_path ( bgpstream_as_path_store_path_t *  store_path)

Get a pointer to the internal path structure from the store path.

Parameters
store_pathpointer to the store path
Returns
a borrowed pointer to the internal AS Path structure

This function is designed to be used when serializing the entire store, and should be considered internal.

Definition at line 487 of file bgpstream_utils_as_path_store.c.

bgpstream_as_path_seg_t* bgpstream_as_path_store_path_get_next_seg ( bgpstream_as_path_store_path_iter_t *  iter)

Get the next segment from the given store path.

Parameters
iterpointer to a valid store path iterator
Returns
borrowed pointer to the next segment, NULL if the path has no more segments
Note
the returned pointer is owned by the path. It MUST NOT be destroyed using bgpstream_as_path_seg_destroy. Also, it is only valid as long as the store path is valid.

Definition at line 464 of file bgpstream_utils_as_path_store.c.

References bgpstream_as_path_get_next_seg(), bgpstream_as_path_iter_reset(), bgpstream_as_path_store_path_iter::peerseg, bgpstream_as_path_store_path_iter::pi, and bgpstream_as_path_store_path_iter::spath.

bgpstream_as_path_t* bgpstream_as_path_store_path_get_path ( bgpstream_as_path_store_path_t *  store_path,
uint32_t  peer_asn 
)

Convert the given store path to a native BGPStream AS Path.

Parameters
store_pathpointer to a store path to convert
peer_asnASN of the peer that observed the path being retrieved
Returns
a pointer to a new AS Path object

The user must destroy the returned path using bgpstream_as_path_destroy. Because this function creates a new path object every time, it should be used sparingly. Consider using the store path iterator functions wherever possible.

Definition at line 397 of file bgpstream_utils_as_path_store.c.

References bgpstream_as_path_clear(), bgpstream_as_path_copy(), bgpstream_as_path_create(), bgpstream_as_path_destroy(), BGPSTREAM_AS_PATH_SEG_ASN, and bgpstream_as_path_update_fields().

int bgpstream_as_path_store_path_is_core ( bgpstream_as_path_store_path_t *  store_path)

Check if the given store path is a core path (i.e.

the peer segment has been removed)

Parameters
store_pathpointer to the store path to get the index of
Returns
1 if the path is a core path, 0 otherwise

This function is designed to be used when serializing the entire store, and should be considered internal.
